Class EditProductDialog

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.control.Dialog<Product>
com.group18.model.EditProductDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.event.EventTarget
public class EditProductDialog extends javafx.scene.control.Dialog<Product>
A dialog for editing the details of a product. This dialog allows the user to modify attributes such as name, price, stock quantity, category, and product image. Provides validation for input fields and updates the product in the database upon confirmation. This class extends the Dialog<Product> and uses JavaFX components to construct the form UI.

  • Field Details

    • productDAO

      private ProductDAO productDAO
      The ProductDAO instance used for managing data persistence and retrieval operations related to products. This variable handles communication with the data source, enabling functions such as querying, adding, updating, and deleting product records. It serves as a key dependency for ensuring the dialog's behavior is consistent with the underlying product data.

    • originalProduct

      private Product originalProduct
      Stores the original state of the product being edited in the dialog. This is used to retain the initial product details before any modifications are made. Useful for comparison, rollback, or validation purposes during the editing process.

    • currentImageData

      private byte[] currentImageData
      Represents the binary data of the currently selected image in the EditProductDialog. This byte array is used for storing and processing the image associated with the product being edited. It may be updated during the dialog's lifecycle when the image is selected, previewed, or replaced.

    • nameField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField nameField
      Represents a text input field for entering or editing the name of a product. This field is a GUI component within the EditProductDialog class, designed to capture and display the product's name during creation or modification.

    • priceField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField priceField
      Represents the input field for entering or displaying the price of a product. This field is used to capture or manipulate the numeric value representing the product's price.

    • stockField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField stockField
      Represents a text field for entering or displaying the stock quantity of a product. This field is used to allow the user to input and modify the stock value associated with a product. It is typically validated to ensure the entered value adheres to expected formats and constraints.

    • imagePreview

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView imagePreview
      Represents a visual component for displaying an image preview within the dialog. Used to provide a graphical view of the currently selected or updated product image.

    • categoryComboBox

      private javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> categoryComboBox
      A ComboBox component used for selecting a product category in the EditProductDialog. This field is specifically designed to allow users to choose from a predefined list of product categories such as "beverage", "biscuit", or "toy". The categoryComboBox is populated and initialized as part of the dialog's setup process, ensuring that the available options correspond to permissible product types.

  • Constructor Details

    • EditProductDialog

      public EditProductDialog(ProductDAO productDAO, Product productToEdit)
      Constructs a new EditProductDialog for editing details of a specified product.
      Parameters:
      productDAO - the data access object used for managing product operations
      productToEdit - the product object to be edited, containing the initial details

  • Method Details

    • setupDialog

      private void setupDialog()
      Configures and initializes the dialog for editing product details. Sets up the title, header text, form layout, input fields, category selection, and image preview component. Includes options for selecting an image for the product. Integrates validation logic to restrict invalid input in form fields. Adds OK and Cancel buttons to the dialog. This method builds the user interface of the dialog dynamically, arranging the components in a GridPane layout. It also initializes the event handlers for specific actions such as image selection.

    • handleSelectImage

      private void handleSelectImage()
      Handles the process of selecting an image file for the product, allowing the user to browse and choose an image from their file system. When a file is selected: - Reads the contents of the file as a byte array and updates the current image data. - Updates the image preview with the selected image. If an error occurs during file reading, an error dialog is displayed to the user. This method uses a FileChooser to open a dialog for selecting image files and supports common image formats such as PNG, JPG, JPEG, and GIF.

    • updateImagePreview

      private void updateImagePreview()
      Updates the image preview displayed in the dialog. This method checks whether the field `currentImageData` contains valid image data. If valid data is present, it attempts to load the data into an `Image` object and assigns it to the `imagePreview`. If the image data is invalid or an error occurs during processing, it displays an error dialog with a relevant message. If no image data is available, the method sets a default image in the preview.

    • setDefaultImage

      private void setDefaultImage()
      Sets a default image to the imagePreview component if no custom image data is available. This method attempts to load a predefined default image from the specified resource path (e.g., "/images/no-image.png"). If the resource is successfully loaded, it is converted into an Image and set to the image preview component, and the byte data of the image is stored in the currentImageData field. If the resource cannot be loaded or an error occurs, the imagePreview component is set to null, and an exception stack trace is printed to the standard error stream. Exceptions: If an IOException occurs during the image reading process, the method handles it by printing the stack trace and setting the imagePreview to null.

    • initializeFields

      private void initializeFields()
      Initializes the input fields and UI components with the values of the product being edited. This includes setting text fields for the product's name, price, and stock, as well as pre-selecting the appropriate category in the category combo box. The method formats and capitalizes the product type for display in the combo box. Additionally, it triggers an update to the image preview, displaying the current image associated with the product.

    • setupValidation

      private void setupValidation()
      Configures real-time validation for input fields in the dialog. The method adds listeners to input fields to ensure valid data entry and dynamically updates the state of the OK button based on the validity of inputs. The following validation rules are enforced: 1. Price Field: Allows only numeric values and a single decimal point. Reverts to the previous valid value if an invalid input is detected. 2. Stock Field: Allows only positive numeric values. Automatically removes any invalid characters from the input. 3. Name Field and Category ComboBox: Tracks changes and triggers validation to ensure these fields are not left empty. Additionally, the OK button is enabled only when all fields satisfy their respective validation requirements. The method performs an initial validation to set the proper state of the OK button when the dialog is first displayed.

    • validateOkButton

      private void validateOkButton()
      Validates the state of the "OK" button in the dialog based on the input provided in the form fields. The button will be enabled only if the required fields meet specific criteria: 1. The text in the nameField is not empty or containing only whitespace. 2. The priceField is not empty. 3. The stockField is not empty. 4. The categoryComboBox has a selected value. When any of the above conditions are not met, the "OK" button will be disabled.

    • updateProduct

      private Product updateProduct()
      Updates a product's details in the database using the current inputs provided by the user. This method creates a new Product object based on the user inputs such as name, category, price, stock, and image data, and attempts to update it using the productDAO. If an exception occurs or the update fails, an error dialog will be displayed.
      Returns:
      the updated Product object if the update operation is successful, or null if the update fails or an error occurs.

    • showErrorDialog

      private void showErrorDialog(String title, String content)
      Displays an error dialog with the specified title and content message.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the error dialog
      content - the content message to be displayed in the error dialog
